question_stem:
Q3. Write R code to get the predicted class labels for the data points in banktest and report the number of points be predicted as “yes” in the blank.
Note: only report the answer, not include the code in the blank provided.
question_stem_html:
Q3. Write R code to get the predicted class labels for the data points in banktest and report the number of points be predicted as “yes” in the blank.
Note: only report the answer, not include the code in the blank provided.

choices.text: not include the code in the blank provided.
choices.text_html: not include the code in the blank provided.

items.solution:
Ans: 5
predicted.class <- predict(nb_model, newdata = banktest[  , -11], type ='class')
table(predicted.class)
# 5 out of 100 points (or customers) be predicted as “yes”.
items.solution_html:
Ans: 5
predicted.class <- predict(nb_model, newdata = banktest[  , -11], type ='class')
table(predicted.class)
# 5 out of 100 points (or customers) be predicted as “yes”.
